item.title: Wind Technician Lead
item.description: RESPONSIBILITIES : Provides leadership and direction for staff involved in regular preventative maintenance and repair activities consistent with policies and procedures on wind turbine generators An employee in this position typically spends 80% of their time providing leadership & assurance to team in the field (performing quality control checks, etc.) and 20% of their time completing administrative tasks (ordering supplies, approving work orders, etc.) Provides daily updates to production supervisor Responsible for scheduling and assigning duties and may assist in evaluating performance Provides expertise to assist in the troubleshooting, identification, and implementation of electronic and mechanical failures, problems and corrective actions, and repairs on wind turbines and other iated equipment Thoroughly understands the mechanics, including both electrical and maintenance of hydraulics, of all wind turbine components Monitors turbine performance and leads documentation & reporting activities. Interprets fault reports, maintains power generation reports and service logs in computer database Attends/leads regular safety meetings and follows appropriate company safety and environmental policies Must be able to work outdoors in inclement weather, climb ladders without assistance, and work at heights greater than 250 feet from the ground surface EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS: A qualified applicant must meet one of the following combinations of education & experience: Completion of a bachelor’s degree in industrial technology or a related field AND two years of directly related experience Completion of a two year technical program (wind technician, electrical, instrumentation & control electronics/fiber, mechanical maintenance, or related); AND five years of directly related mechanical or electrical repair experience A two year Wind Technician Program AND five years of directly related mechanical or electrical repair experience Completion of high school diploma or equivalent AND seven years of directly related mechanical or electrical repair experience. SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: Must possess advanced understanding of wind turbine operations Must be able to work outdoors in inclement weather, climb ladders without assistance, and work at heights greater than 250 feet from the ground surface Valid Driver’s license required Must obtain commercial applicator certification within six months of hire Must be able to understand mechanics, hydraulics, and electricity (including reading & interpreting drawings); interpret documentation and support continuous improvement; and use SCADA systems for troubleshooting First aid, CPR, AED, high angle rope rescue certification, forklift certification, and OSHA 10 certification preferred Employer will not sponsor visas for position External applicants must apply online via www.allete.com/careers . ALLETE is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age, marital status, membership or activity in a local human rights commission, status with regard to public assistance or any other protected class. If you are an individual with disabilities who needs accommodation or you are having difficulty using our website to apply for employment, please contact our Human Resources department at 218-723-7553 . EEO/AA/F/M/Vet/Disabled
item.taleo:html-description:
RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Provides leadership and direction for staff involved in regular preventative maintenance and repair activities consistent with policies and procedures on wind turbine generators
  • An employee in this position typically spends 80% of their time providing leadership & assurance to team in the field (performing quality control checks, etc.) and 20% of their time completing administrative tasks (ordering supplies, approving work orders, etc.)
  • Provides daily updates to production supervisor
  • Responsible for scheduling and assigning duties and may assist in evaluating performance
  • Provides expertise to assist in the troubleshooting, identification, and implementation of electronic and mechanical failures, problems and corrective actions, and repairs on wind turbines and other iated equipment
  • Thoroughly understands the mechanics, including both electrical and maintenance of hydraulics, of all wind turbine components
  • Monitors turbine performance and leads documentation & reporting activities. Interprets fault reports, maintains power generation reports and service logs in computer database
  • Attends/leads regular safety meetings and follows appropriate company safety and environmental policies
  • Must be able to work outdoors in inclement weather, climb ladders without assistance, and work at heights greater than 250 feet from the ground surface

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

A qualified applicant must meet one of the following combinations of education & experience:

  1. Completion of a bachelor’s degree in industrial technology or a related field AND two years of directly related experience
  2. Completion of a two year technical program (wind technician, electrical, instrumentation & control electronics/fiber, mechanical maintenance, or related); AND five years of directly related mechanical or electrical repair experience 
  3. A two year Wind Technician Program AND five years of directly related mechanical or electrical repair experience
  4. Completion of high school diploma or equivalent AND seven years of directly related mechanical or electrical repair experience.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:

  • Must possess advanced understanding of wind turbine operations
  • Must be able to work outdoors in inclement weather, climb ladders without assistance, and work at heights greater than 250 feet from the ground surface
  • Valid Driver’s license required
  • Must obtain commercial applicator certification within six months of hire
  • Must be able to understand mechanics, hydraulics, and electricity (including reading & interpreting drawings); interpret documentation and support continuous improvement; and use SCADA systems for troubleshooting
  • First aid, CPR, AED, high angle rope rescue certification, forklift certification, and OSHA 10 certification preferred

Employer will not sponsor visas for position

External applicants must apply online via www.allete.com/careers.


ALLETE is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age, marital status, membership or activity in a local human rights commission, status with regard to public assistance or any other protected class.

If you are an individual with disabilities who needs accommodation or you are having difficulty using our website to apply for employment, please contact our Human Resources department at 218-723-7553.

EEO/AA/F/M/Vet/Disabled

item.title: Regulatory Revenue Analyst I/II
item.description: RESPONSIBILITIES: Assists with the billing of large power, municipal, and wholesale customers. Prepares or reviews the monthly fuel clause calculation for retail, resale, and intersystem sales. Prepares or reviews the monthly adjustments granted for rate relief by the regulators. Analyzes MISO settlement statements for the many charge types and their components and prepares the accounting entries for invoicing and accruals. Applies departmental policies and practices, assuring compliance with company and regulatory requirements. Participates in the documentation of policies and procedures. Assists in the preparation of various external regulatory reports and filings. Participates in the design, implementation, maintenance and documentation of new and/or existing systems. Demonstrates leadership and team characteristics. Applies contract provisions in the preparation of bills for large power customers, and may assist in billing municipal and wholesale customers. REQUIRED EDUCATION: Bachelor’s degree in accounting strongly preferred, but an equivalent degree with applicable accounting course work may be considered. REQUIRED EXPERIENCE: Level I – No experience required Level II – Four years or more of related work experience SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills required in order to establish and maintain relationships. This position may be subject to assessment of skills, job match and/or aptitude. Employer will not sponsor Visas for position. External applicants must apply online via www.allete.com/careers. ALLETE is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age, marital status, membership or activity in a local human rights commission, status with regard to public assistance or any other protected class. If you are an individual with disabilities who needs accommodation or you are having difficulty using our website to apply for employment, please contact our Human Resources department at 218-723-7553. item.title: Accounting Analyst I - Opportunity Posting
item.description: RESPONSIBILITIES: Assists with preparation, processing, review, analysis, and maintenance of periodic and miscellaneous accounting entries, accounting, budget, forecasted or other financial data and transactions, company consolidations, financial and operating reports, and other accounting processes for ALLETE and its affiliates. Applies departmental policies and practices, assuring compliance with company and regulatory requirements. Participates in the documentation of accounting policies and procedures. Assists in the preparation of various external regulatory reports and filings (SEC, MPUC, FERC, IRS, etc.) Participates in the design, implementation, maintenance and documentation of new and/or existing systems. Incumbents may work in any of the following areas: general accounting, property accounting, tax, budget, or financial reporting. REQUIRED EDUCATION: Bachelor’s degree in accounting strongly preferred, but an equivalent degree with applicable accounting course work may be considered. REQUIRED EXPERIENCE: No experience required. SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills required in order to establish and maintain relationships. This position may be subject to assessment of skills, job match and/or aptitude. Employer will not sponsor visas for position. External applicants must apply online via www.allete.com/careers. ALLETE is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age, marital status, membership or activity in a local human rights commission, status with regard to public assistance or any other protected class. item.title: Accounting Associate I/II - Opportunity Posting
item.description: RESPONSIBILITIES : Provides research, analysis, coordination and processing of routine accounting work, including ensuring accounting transactions, invoices, entries, billings, and balances are complete and accurate to meet schedules, deadlines and accounting/regulatory standards; Creating, developing and analyzing manual and computerized reports/spreadsheets; Providing information, procedural assistance, and training to others; Coordinating and processing computerized systems to ensure reliable and available accounting data, participating in enhancements, changes, and/or implementation of computer systems; Completing special projects as assigned. REQUIRED EDUCATION: High school plus a two year vocational certificate in accounting or equivalent. Equivalent may include 2 year vocational certificates in business or other related fields but only if accounting courses, at least through intermediate level, have been taken. REQUIRED EXPERIENCE: Level I – No experience required. Level II – Four years or more job related experience required SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: Requires good communication skills to establish and maintain positive working relationships. This position may be subject to assessment of skills, job match and/or aptitude. Employer will not sponsor Visas for position. External applicants must apply online via www.allete.com/careers. ALLETE is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age, marital status, membership or activity in a local human rights commission, status with regard to public assistance or any other protected class. item.title: Business Analyst I - ALLETE Clean Energy
item.description: GENERAL PURPOSE : Supports ALLETE Clean Energy (ACE) and its affiliates by providing a variety of accounting, financial, and budget related support. Assists with the preparation of periodic and miscellaneous accounting entries; processes accounting data and transactions; assists with review and analysis of accounting or financial data; supports landowner payment process; assists with the preparation of financial and operating reports and variance analyses; and participates in other accounting processes. Responsibilities include internal & external reporting, intercompany billing coordination & payments to ALLETE, interfacing with internal & external stakeholders, inventory and fixed asset oversight, debt compliance, cash projections, and a variety of related duties. Participates in the annual operating and construction budgets, assists with the documentation of ACE policies and procedures; and contract retention & management. Complies with standards to assure conformity with generally accepted accounting principles. May be required to represent ACE to third parties including but not limited to: landowners, creditors, and partners. Initiative to complete assigned duties is required, as well as organizational skills and the ability to perform duties under time constraints. Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills required in order to establish and maintain relationships. RESPONSIBILITIES : Support ALLETE Clean Energy (ACE) and its affiliates by providing a variety of accounting and budget related support, primarily for on-going construction projects Process accounting data and transactions Assist with review and analysis of accounting or financial data Support landowner payment process for new developments Assist with the preparation of financial and operating reports and variance analyses Internal & external reporting Intercompany billing coordination & payments to ALLETE Interfacing with internal & external stakeholders Cash projections A variety of related duties REQUIRED EDUCATION: Bachelor’s degree in accounting strongly preferred, but an equivalent degree with applicable accounting course work may be considered. ​Candidates with a Bachelor’s degree (in accounting or equivalent) obtained by December 31, 2019 will be considered. REQUIRED EXPERIENCE: No experience required. SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: Proficient with accounting systems and Microsoft Office software suite. Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills required in order to establish and maintain relationships. This position may be subject to assessment of skills, job match and/or aptitude. Employer will not sponsor Visas for position. External applicants must apply online via www.allete.com/careers. ALLETE is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age, marital status, membership or activity in a local human rights commission, status with regard to public assistance or any other protected class. If you are an individual with disabilities who needs accommodation or you are having difficulty using our website to apply for employment, please contact our Human Resources department at 218-723-7553. EEO/AA/F/M/Vet/Disabled
item.taleo:html-description:
GENERAL PURPOSE  :

Supports ALLETE Clean Energy (ACE) and its affiliates by providing a variety of accounting, financial, and budget related support. Assists with the preparation of periodic and miscellaneous accounting entries; processes accounting data and transactions; assists with review and analysis of accounting or financial data; supports landowner payment process; assists with the preparation of financial and operating reports and variance analyses; and participates in other accounting processes. Responsibilities include internal & external reporting, intercompany billing coordination & payments to ALLETE, interfacing with internal & external stakeholders, inventory and fixed asset oversight, debt compliance, cash projections, and a variety of related duties.

Participates in the annual operating and construction budgets, assists with the documentation of ACE policies and procedures; and contract retention & management. Complies with standards to assure conformity with generally accepted accounting principles.  May be required to represent ACE to third parties including but not limited to: landowners, creditors, and partners.  Initiative to complete assigned duties is required, as well as organizational skills and the ability to perform duties under time constraints.  Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills required in order to establish and maintain relationships.

RESPONSIBILITIES :

  • Support ALLETE Clean Energy (ACE) and its affiliates by providing a variety of accounting and budget related support, primarily for on-going construction projects
  • Process accounting data and transactions
  •  Assist with review and analysis of accounting or financial data
  • Support landowner payment process for new developments
  • Assist with the preparation of financial and operating reports and variance analyses
  • Internal & external reporting
  • Intercompany billing coordination & payments to ALLETE
  • Interfacing with internal & external stakeholders
  • Cash projections
  • A variety of related duties

REQUIRED EDUCATION:

  • Bachelor’s degree in accounting strongly preferred, but an equivalent degree with applicable accounting course work may be considered.
    • ​Candidates with a Bachelor’s degree (in accounting or equivalent) obtained by December 31, 2019 will be considered.

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:

  • No experience required.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:

  • Proficient with accounting systems and Microsoft Office software suite.
  • Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills required in order to establish and maintain relationships.
  • This position may be subject to assessment of skills, job match and/or aptitude.

Employer will not sponsor Visas for position.

External applicants must apply online via www.allete.com/careers.

item.title: Security Specialist I
item.description: RESPONSIBILITIES: Serve as the corporate access control expert. Maintain and update the access control system, visitor management system and intrusion alarm system. Assist with surveillance camera projects and integration with the access control system. Provide training and support for Security Control Operators. Review and recommend changes to access control, visitor management and alarm response procedures. Initiates emergency response by notifying ALLETE personnel and emergency response teams. Initiate and maintain databases for security account information reporting. Strong interpersonal and communication skills required to establish and maintain positive working relationships. REQUIRED EDUCATION: Bachelor’s degree in Criminal Justice, Emergency Management or closely related field of study. REQUIRED EXPERIENCE: Two years or more of job related work experience in Security Management systems. Must have solid working knowledge of office software (word processing, spreadsheet, database, email), and security management systems. SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: This position is subject to hearing, vision, and color perception assessment. This position may be subject to assessment of skills, job match and/or aptitude. Incumbent must possess valid Class D driver’s license and the ability and credibility to acquire TWIC (Transportation Workers Identification Credentials). Requires effective and consistent communication skills. Employer will not sponsor Visas for position. External applicants must apply online via www.allete.com/careers. ALLETE is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age, marital status, membership or activity in a local human rights commission, status with regard to public assistance or any other protected class. If you are an individual with disabilities who needs accommodation or you are having difficulty using our website to apply for employment, please contact our Human Resources department at 218-723-7553. EEO/AA/F/M/Vet/Disabled

item.title: Project Delivery Manager I/II
item.description: RESPONSIBILITIES: Provide project management leadership to Engineering and Project Delivery (EPD) under close-to-moderate supervision. Has responsibility for projects, and programs involving Minnesota Power operations. Assist in developing and communicating project plans to execute project scope, schedule, and cost with internal and external stakeholders. Perform scheduling, project work breakdown, cost control and other project control functions. Projects will support electric utility infrastructure improvements along with a variety of support services projects. May lead independent projects or bundled projects and on-site construction oversight when needed. Manage a variety of construction and professional services contracts. An employee in this position is developing knowledge of the organization, processes, best practices, and customers while analyzing possible solutions using standard procedures and solving a range of straightforward to moderate problems. REQUIRED EDUCATION: Bachelor’s degree required. Certification as a Project Management Professional (PMP), or other relevant Project Management Institute (PMI) certification program strongly preferred. REQUIRED EXPERIENCE: Level I Two years of project management experience in project controls, design, construction, accounting, budgeting, and or a related field. Electric utility, infrastructure, or industrial fields experience preferred Level II Six years of directly related project management experience in project controls, design, construction, accounting, budgeting, and or a related field. Electric utility, infrastructure, or industrial fields experience required ***Applicable military service/experience may be considered as an equivalency to satisfy the education and/or experience requirement.*** SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: Travel is occasionally required within Minnesota Power service territory, Northwest Wisconsin, and North Dakota. Valid Driver's license required Requires a high level of interpersonal skills to establish and maintain positive and productive working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. Analytical, investigation, and problem solving skills This position may be subject to assessment of skills, job match and/or aptitude. Employer will not sponsor Visas for position. External applicants must apply online via www.allete.com/careers. ALLETE is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age, marital status, membership or activity in a local human rights commission, status with regard to public assistance or any other protected class. If you are an individual with disabilities who needs accommodation or you are having difficulty using our website to apply for employment, please contact our Human Resources department at 218-723-7553. EEO/AA/F/M/Vet/Disabled

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Provide project management leadership to Engineering and Project Delivery (EPD) under close-to-moderate supervision. 
  • Has responsibility for projects, and programs involving Minnesota Power operations.
  • Assist in developing and communicating project plans to execute project scope, schedule, and cost with internal and external stakeholders.

  • Projects will support electric utility infrastructure improvements along with a variety of support services projects.
  • May lead independent projects or bundled projects and on-site construction oversight when needed.
  • Manage a variety of construction and professional services contracts. 
  • An employee in this position is developing knowledge of the organization, processes, best practices, and customers while analyzing possible solutions using standard procedures and solving a range of straightforward to moderate problems.

    • Certification as a Project Management Professional (PMP), or other relevant Project Management Institute (PMI) certification program strongly preferred.

item.taleo:html-description:
RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Provide high level administrative support and coordination for departmental activities including managing records and information, coordination and scheduling of staff for work activities and training to meet project and other schedules.
  • Gather and organize information for use in meeting job objectives and to provide to others.
  • Perform record keeping to support departmental activities.
  • Requires good interpersonal skills to establish and maintain cooperative and productive working relationships.
  • Process line workers time cards, fix it letters, inspections, and metrics, phone support for planners.

REQUIRED EDUCATION:

  • High school diploma or equivalent, plus one year specialized secretarial training or equivalent.

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:

  • Four years or more of job-related experience.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:

  • This position may be subject to assessment of skills, job match and/or aptitude.

Employer will not sponsor Visas for position.

 

External applicants must apply online via www.allete.com/careers. 

 

ALLETE is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age, marital status, membership or activity in a local human rights commission, status with regard to public assistance or any other protected class.

 

If you are an individual with disabilities who needs accommodation or you are having difficulty using our website to apply for employment, please contact our Human Resources department at 218-723-7553.

 

EEO/AA/F/M/Vet/Disabled

item.title: Engineer II/III/Senior
item.description: ALLETE/MN Power, located in Duluth, MN has an opening for an Engineer II/III/Senior. Duluth, MN is a wonderful place to live; it achieves a rare balance between city life and the great outdoors, all with a small town feel. Go one direction and you’ll see an endless horizon where the largest freshwater lake in the world meets the sky; go another and you will find rocky cliffs and pristine forests with miles of trails to explore; change direction again and you’ll discover shopping, restaurants and microbreweries. Each day there are numerous events to enjoy including sporting events, festivals, arts, music, theater and so much more. Duluth is a great place to call home. Summary: Substation Engineer position available to design control, protection, relaying and SCADA for medium and high voltage electrical substations. This position will work both independently and collaboratively with a cross-functional team to meet the project needs of a variety of stakeholders. Stakeholders range from intra company departments to municipalities and large industrial power customers. Projects vary in length from weeks to multiyear with the opportunities to design solutions to both familiar and unique problems. This position provides opportunities to visit equipment manufacturing facilities and professional development training. The Substation Engineer would perform site visits for field verifications at medium and high voltage substations before, during and after construction. RESPONSIBILITIES: Works with a cross-functional team to execute and close out projects. Provides technical leadership and direction for engineering staff in area of expertise to assure application of sound engineering practices in a cost-effective manner to enhance customer operations, maintain reliability of systems and safety for MP employees and the public. Coordinates with stakeholders to develop control and protection for medium and high voltage electrical substation equipment and transmission lines. Performs control and SCADA engineering for all aspects of electrical substations including working with design teams to produce conceptual, preliminary, and final design of substation projects. Design responsibilities include development and modification of one-line diagrams, protection and control wiring schematics, and performs necessary calculations to complete and verify protection and control design for medium and high voltage substations Directs work of drafting technicians to create protection, relaying and control bid, fabrication, and construction drawing packages. Specifies and orders substation protection and control equipment, including relays, RTUs, and control enclosures. Reviews manufacturer submittals and approval drawings. Prepares bid documents for engineering and installation work to consultants or contractors. Reviews bids and makes award recommendations. Directs consultant work and review submittals. Provides SCADA expertise to project teams, other departments and field crews as needed. Develops point lists for configuration of RTUs and EMS. Follows NERC CIP standards for applicable project implementations. Provides technical assistance to other departments and field crews as needed. Has knowledge of local, state and industry codes and standards, for example OSHA, NESC, IEEE, NERC CIP. Perform site visits to substations in Minnesota, Wisconsin and North Dakota to scope projects and perform field verifications. Performs administrative work relating to projects and assignments; acts as staff advisor and technical consultant within and outside assigned department in area of expertise. This includes preparation of accurate schedules and budget estimates for substation work. Promotes positive change in Minnesota Power business strategy through achievement of customer specific objectives and technological innovation of practical and profitable nature, (i.e., stakeholders benefit). Requires high level of interpersonal skills to establish and maintain positive and productive working relationships. REQUIRED EDUCATION: Electrical Engineering Bachelor’s degree from ABET accredited university in engineering required. REQUIRED EXPERIENCE: Engineer II: A minimum of two years job-related experience Engineer in Training Certificate Engineer III: A minimum of four years job-related experience Professional Engineer License with ability to become registered in MN, WI, and ND within 6 months Engineer Senior: A minimum of eight years of job-related experience Professional Engineer License with ability to become registered in MN, WI, and ND within 6 months A Master's degree in engineering may be equivalent for up to one year of related experience REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: Familiar with medium and high voltage substations and associated equipment Experience with control and protection equipment for medium and high voltage substations Experience with specialized software and devices to complete engineering including SEL, GE, and CISCO or similar Experience in preparing and assembling bidding and construction documents (specifications, drawings, etc.) and supporting construction and commissioning DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS: Experience with DNP3 (experience with Harris H6000 is a plus) Basic understanding of communication mediums and protocols used in industrial settings (Serial RS-232, RS-485, Ethernet, etc.) Control Cable schedule creation and control cable sizing Wiring Schematic creation Manufacturer drawing review and approval Previous utility work SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: Valid Driver's license required This position may be subject to assessment of skills, job match and/or aptitude Employer will not sponsor Visas for position. External applicants must apply online via www.allete.com/careers . ALLETE is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age, marital status, membership or activity in a local human rights commission, status with regard to public assistance or any other protected class. If you are an individual with disabilities who needs accommodation or you are having difficulty using our website to apply for employment, please contact our Human Resources department at 218-723-7553 . EEO/AA/F/M/Vet/Disabled
item.taleo:html-description:
ALLETE/MN Power, located in Duluth, MN has an opening for an Engineer II/III/Senior. 

Duluth, MN is a wonderful place to live; it achieves a rare balance between city life and the great outdoors, all with a small town feel.  Go one direction and you’ll see an endless horizon where the largest freshwater lake in the world meets the sky; go another and you will find rocky cliffs and pristine forests with miles of trails to explore; change direction again and you’ll discover shopping, restaurants and microbreweries.  Each day there are numerous events to enjoy including sporting events, festivals, arts, music, theater and so much more.  Duluth is a great place to call home.

Summary:

Substation Engineer position available to design control, protection, relaying and SCADA for medium and high voltage electrical substations. This position will work both independently and collaboratively with a cross-functional team to meet the project needs of a variety of stakeholders. Stakeholders range from intra company departments to municipalities and large industrial power customers. Projects vary in length from weeks to multiyear with the opportunities to design solutions to both familiar and unique problems. This position provides opportunities to visit equipment manufacturing facilities and professional development training. The Substation Engineer would perform site visits for field verifications at medium and high voltage substations before, during and after construction.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Works with a cross-functional team to execute and close out projects.
  • Provides technical leadership and direction for engineering staff in area of expertise to assure application of sound engineering practices in a cost-effective manner to enhance customer operations, maintain reliability of systems and safety for MP employees and the public.
  • Coordinates with stakeholders to develop control and protection for medium and high voltage electrical substation equipment and transmission lines.
  • Performs control and SCADA engineering for all aspects of electrical substations including working with design teams to produce conceptual, preliminary, and final design of substation projects. Design responsibilities include development and modification of one-line diagrams, protection and control wiring schematics, and performs necessary calculations to complete and verify protection and control design for medium and high voltage substations
  • Directs work of drafting technicians to create protection, relaying and control bid, fabrication, and construction drawing packages.
  • Specifies and orders substation protection and control equipment, including relays, RTUs, and control enclosures. Reviews manufacturer submittals and approval drawings.
  • Prepares bid documents for engineering and installation work to consultants or contractors. Reviews bids and makes award recommendations. Directs consultant work and review submittals.
  • Provides SCADA expertise to project teams, other departments and field crews as needed. Develops point lists for configuration of RTUs and EMS.
  • Follows NERC CIP standards for applicable project implementations.
  • Provides technical assistance to other departments and field crews as needed.
  • Has knowledge of local, state and industry codes and standards, for example OSHA, NESC, IEEE, NERC CIP.
  • Perform site visits to substations in Minnesota, Wisconsin and North Dakota to scope projects and perform field verifications.
  • Performs administrative work relating to projects and assignments; acts as staff advisor and technical consultant within and outside assigned department in area of expertise. This includes preparation of accurate schedules and budget estimates for substation work.
  • Promotes positive change in Minnesota Power business strategy through achievement of customer specific objectives and technological innovation of practical and profitable nature, (i.e., stakeholders benefit).
  • Requires high level of interpersonal skills to establish and maintain positive and productive working relationships.

REQUIRED EDUCATION:

  • Electrical Engineering Bachelor’s degree from ABET accredited university in engineering required.

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:

Engineer II: 

  • A minimum of two years job-related experience
  • Engineer in Training Certificate

Engineer III: 

  • A minimum of four years job-related experience
  • Professional Engineer License with ability to become registered in MN, WI, and ND within 6 months

Engineer Senior: 

  • A minimum of eight years of job-related experience
  • Professional Engineer License with ability to become registered in MN, WI, and ND within 6 months

A Master's degree in engineering may be equivalent for up to one year of related experience

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Familiar with medium and high voltage substations and associated equipment
  • Experience with control and protection equipment for medium and high voltage substations
  • Experience with specialized software and devices to complete engineering including SEL, GE, and CISCO or similar
  • Experience in preparing and assembling bidding and construction documents (specifications, drawings, etc.) and supporting construction and commissioning

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Experience with DNP3 (experience with Harris H6000 is a plus)
  • Basic understanding of communication mediums and protocols used in industrial settings (Serial RS-232, RS-485, Ethernet, etc.)
  • Control Cable schedule creation and control cable sizing
  • Wiring Schematic creation
  • Manufacturer drawing review and approval
  • Previous utility work

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:

  • Valid Driver's license required
  • This position may be subject to assessment of skills, job match and/or aptitude

Employer will not sponsor Visas for position.

External applicants must apply online via www.allete.com/careers .

ALLETE is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age, marital status, membership or activity in a local human rights commission, status with regard to public assistance or any other protected class.

If you are an individual with disabilities who needs accommodation or you are having difficulty using our website to apply for employment, please contact our Human Resources department at 218-723-7553.

EEO/AA/F/M/Vet/Disabled
